author: @NewsChannel10
title: Eastern New Mexico University offers support to wildfire victims
text: PORTALES, N.M. (KFDA) - Eastern New Mexico University is offering assistance to those impacted by the wildfires near Ruidoso. According to a letter from ENMU staff, all ENMU Ruidoso faculty and staff are reported safe. The ENMU Ruidoso Branch Community College campus is also secure. If people would like to donate specifically to ENMU-Ruidoso students, faculty and staff, the ENMU-Ruidoso Foundation has established the 2024 Fire Recovery Fund. The fund is used to assist students, faculty and staff of the ENMU-Ruidoso Brach Community College. To donate, click here . ENMU is also directing those who would like to assist those impacted by the fire to the Community Foundation of Lincoln County. The Shelter Fund was created to assist community members who have struggled due to fires or flooding in Lincoln County. To donate, click https://www.cfolc.org/shelterfund. For additional information regarding resources, visit the New Mexico Department of Homeland Security and Emergency Management’s website . Copyright 2024 KFDA. All rights reserved.

author: Press Association
title: This is unfair – Ashley Judd on Harvey Weinstein’s conviction being overturned
text:
Actress Ashley Judd has described it as “unfair to survivors” after a court overturned Hollywood movie mogul Harvey Weinstein’s 2020 conviction for rape.
Double Jeopardy star Judd, who was among the first women to make allegations on the record against Weinstein, is also a campaigner on women’s rights.
While sharing an article that stated that Weinstein’s 23-year sentence for rape had been overturned in an Instagram story, Judd wrote: “This is unfair to survivors. We Live In Our Truth. We know what happened.”
Ashley Judd was among the first women to make allegations against Harvey Weinstein (Anthony Harvey/PA) Hollywood producer Weinstein is still in prison after being sentenced to 16 years for rape and sexual assault in Los Angeles last year.
Judd previously alleged she thought she was attending a breakfast hotel meeting in 1997, while filming the thriller Kiss The Girls, when he began pressuring her to give and receive massages and to watch him shower.
In a bid to get out of the bathroom, she claims she resorted to striking a deal with him that she would say yes to his advances when she won an Oscar for one of his films.
Speaking at a press conference in New York City on Thursday, Judd said: “This today is an act of institutional betrayal.
Harvey Weinstein was sentenced to 16 years in jail last year (PA) “And our institutions betray survivors of male sexual violence, and we need to work within and without the systems to start having what is known as ‘institutional courage’.”
Activist Tarana Burke, who started the #MeToo movement, also spoke at the event and said: “Many people, many survivors and those who love and support survivors probably thought that that original verdict meant that there was going to be a change, that it marked a change, marked a difference in how this justice system was going to move and operate.
“And I think that we felt, and a lot of us felt, that we were on a road to seeing a different America. And this moment makes it feel like we were wrong.”
She added: “What does this mean for the MeToo movement?”
“I want you to hear this. This is not a blow to the movement. It is a clarion call. And we are prepared to answer that call.”
Allegations against Weinstein, the once powerful and feared studio boss behind such Oscar winners as Pulp Fiction and Shakespeare In Love, ushered in a global #MeToo movement in 2017, where women across the world shared stories of their own experiences with sexual assault.
In 2019, the United States District Court in Los Angeles dismissed a sexual harassment claim made by Judd against Weinstein in which she said he defamed her, damaging her career.
Tarana Burke, an activist who started the MeToo movement (Ian West/PA) Mira Sorvino, who previously made allegations against Weinstein and won an Oscar for Mighty Aphrodite, tweeted that she was “disgusted” at the justice system and “horrified”.
During a press conference, Weinstein’s lawyer Arthur Aidala called the Court of Appeal’s ruling “a great day for America”.
“It may sound like an exaggeration but it’s not, today’s legal ruling is a great day for America because it instils in us the faith that there is a justice system,” he said.
The majority decision by the Court of Appeal in New York read that “the trial court erroneously admitted testimony of uncharged, alleged prior sexual acts against persons other than the complainants of the underlying crimes” and this was “an abuse of judicial discretion”.
A spokesperson for the Manhattan District Attorney’s Office told the PA news agency: “We will do everything in our power to retry this case, and remain steadfast in our commitment to survivors of sexual assault.”

author: festivaldisanremo
title: Il bassista originale dei Ratos de Porão Jarbas “Jabá” Alves è morto a 60 anni
text:
La band crossover brasiliana
Ratos de Porão ha appena annunciato il membro fondatore Jarbas “Jabá” Alves è morto all’età di 60 anni.
Alves è stato nella band tra il 1981 e il 1993 e si è esibito in tutti gli album tra Crucificados Pelo Sistema nel 1984 e RDP Vivo nel 1992, inclusi Descanse Em Paz (1986), Cada Dia Mais Sujo e Agressivo (1987), Brasil (1989) e Anarcofobia (1991).
Leggermente meno conosciuti negli Stati Uniti, ma ancora amati in tutto il mondo nei circoli metal e punk, i Ratos de Porão sono acclamati come una delle band crossover originali che uniscono punk e thrash e gettano le basi per l'hardcore e il metalcore. Hanno iniziato e sono rimasti fuori dal Brasile, ma sono stati anche in tournée negli Stati Uniti, in Europa e in altre parti del mondo.
La notizia è stata originariamente condivisa su Instagram, dove la band ha postato dicendo: “Descanse em paz amigo Jarbas”, che si traduce in “Riposa in pace, amico Jarbas”.
Anche Max Cavalera , probabilmente il musicista brasiliano più famoso della musica pesante nel corso della storia, ha reso omaggio dicendo:
“Descanse em paz irmão Jaba Xoba !!! Riposa in pace fratello Jaba."
Finora, la causa della morte di Jabá non è stata rivelata, ma ha avuto problemi al fegato per gran parte della sua vita, quindi questa potrebbe essere probabilmente la ragione per cui è morto. Dopo aver lasciato la band negli anni '90, il cantante João Gordo intervenne e si unì al gruppo.
Jabá ha anche
lottato con problemi di dipendenza mentre era nella band, e se ne è andato poco prima che pubblicassero il loro album di testi interamente in inglese del 1994, Just Another Crime in Massacreland .
I nostri pensieri sono rivolti agli amici e alla famiglia di Jabá mentre apprendono la sua perdita.
Il post
Il bassista originale dei Ratos de Porão Jarbas “Jabá” Alves morto a 60 anni è apparso per la prima volta su MetalSucks .

author: Salman Khan
title: Rohit Sharma Guides India to Victory in Historic Double Super Over
text:
Contrasting Claims on Women's Rights in Taliban-Ruled Afghanistan
Rohit Sharma Guides India to Victory in Historic Double Super Over
A cricket match that was a spectacle on all fronts unfolded at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium as India faced Afghanistan in the third T20I. Marked by a top-order collapse, a remarkable recovery, two Super Overs, and a series victory, the match was a rollercoaster ride that kept spectators on the edge of their seats.
Rohit Sharma’s Unforgettable Knock
In a surprising turn of events, Captain Rohit Sharma, after two consecutive ducks, found himself steering the Indian innings from a precarious 22/4. Sharma, with his back against the wall, crafted a masterful 61-ball 121 not out, becoming the most successful century maker in T20Is with his fifth century. His performance was not just about the runs, but the timing and the situation, which made it even more special. Alongside him, Rinku Singh made a significant contribution, scoring a quickfire 69 off 39 balls, helping India to reach a formidable 212/4.
Unprecedented Super Over Drama
The match was far from over, as an extraordinary conclusion ensued with not one, but two Super Overs – a first in international cricket. The first Super Over ended in a thrilling tie at 16 runs each, setting the stage for a second decider. India, under pressure, managed to secure the second one, scoring 11/2 compared to Afghanistan’s 1/2, thus securing a nail-biting 10-run victory.
Looking Ahead: World Cup Preparations
The series served as a testing ground for team composition ahead of the World Cup. Despite the initial top-order collapse, the performance of players like Rinku Singh and Yashasvi Jaiswal provided glimpses of India’s bench strength. However, it was Rohit’s stellar century and astute captaincy that may have tilted the ongoing debate about the team’s lineup in his favour.

author: DTNEXT Bureau
title: India to maintain growth velocity in 2024: Assocham
text: India to maintain growth velocity in 2024: Assocham “India’s macro picture looks convincing with the economy following a trend growth of seven per cent with critical building blocks combining to give it brighter prospects,’ Assocham Secretary General Deepak Sood said. NEW DELHI: India is likely to remain the fastest-growing major economy in the world in 2024 on the back of strong consumer demand leading to a pick up in investment across sectors such as construction, hospitality and infrastructure including railways and aviation, Assocham said on Thursday. India retained the tag of the world’s fastest-growing major economy, with its GDP expanding by a faster-than-expected rate of 7.6 per cent in the July-September quarter on booster shots from government spending and manufacturing. The country’s Gross domestic product (GDP) growth of 7.6 per cent beat most estimates, including 6.5 per cent projected by the RBI. The growth compares to 6.2 per cent in the same quarter last year and 7.8 per cent expansion in the preceding quarter, official data showed. India’s GDP growth beat China’s 4.9 per cent rise in July-Sept, while the Western economies are getting crushed under high-interest rates and energy prices. “India’s macro picture looks convincing with the economy following a trend growth of seven per cent with critical building blocks combining to give it brighter prospects,’ Assocham Secretary General Deepak Sood said. According to the industry body, India Inc led by financials, construction, hotels, aviation, automobile and other manufacturing areas like electronics are on a strong pitch to further improve performance in the coming year.

author: easdnews
title: Several healthy diet patterns are associated with reduced risk of type 2 diabetes regardless of ethnicity - shows meta-analysis of more than 800,000 people | EurekAlert!
text:
A large new meta-analysis of more than 800,000 participants to be presented at this year’s Annual Meeting of the European Association for the Study of Diabetes (EASD) in Vienna, Austria (15-19 September) shows that high adherence to three well-established healthy eating patterns is linked to a lower risk of type 2 diabetes, regardless of one’s ethnicity. The study is led by PhD student and Gates Cambridge Scholar Ms Jia Yi Lee, Professor Nita Forouhi, and colleagues from the MRC Epidemiology Unit, University of Cambridge, UK.
The study investigated three healthy dietary patterns: the Mediterranean Diet, the Alternative Healthy Eating Index (AHEI), and the Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension (DASH). All three have been recommended for general health and their potential to reduce chronic disease risk.
Through a systematic search of published studies, the authors identified 33 publications reporting the association between these dietary patterns and type 2 diabetes. When all the available evidence was combined, the results showed that people who were in the top 10% for adherence to each dietary pattern had significantly lower risks of developing type 2 diabetes compared to those with the 10% lowest adherence : a 17% lower risk for the Mediterranean Diet, a 21% lower risk for AHEI, and a 23% lower risk for the DASH diet. Importantly, the potential benefits of these dietary patterns did not appear to vary significantly across African, Asian, European, and Hispanic ethnic groups, despite known ethnic differences in dietary culture, as well as diabetes risk.
While some of the lowered risks did not reach statistical significance among Hispanics and mixed ethnic groups, this may be due to the limited data available from non-European ethnic groups in existing studies. Over one-third of the data included in this analysis came from people of European descent, highlighting the need for more research from underrepresented populations.
The authors conclude: “Although more research is needed in specific populations, this study strengthens the evidence that the Mediterranean, AHEI, and DASH dietary patterns may reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes across diverse ethnic groups, and that they can be promoted across all populations.”
This analysis is part of a larger ongoing review examining the associations of various dietary patterns, including plant-based dietary patterns (that include vegetarian and vegan diets) with type 2 diabetes risk. The researchers will further determine whether similar benefits extend across ethnic groups for these other dietary patterns.
Ms Jia Yi Lee, MRC Epidemiology Unit, University of Cambridge School of Clinical Medicine, Cambridge, UK E) JiaYi.Lee@mrc-epid.cam.ac.uk (note Ms Lee is currently in Singapore, 7 hours ahead of UK time)
Professor Nita Forouhi, MRC Epidemiology Unit, University of Cambridge School of Clinical Medicine, Cambridge, UK E) nita.forouhi@mrc-epid.cam.ac.uk
Alternative contact: Paul Browne in the MRC Epidemiology Unit Comms Team: E) paul.browne@mrc-epid.cam.ac.uk
Alternative contact: Tony Kirby in the EASD Press Office T) +44 7834 385827 E)
tony.kirby@tonykirby.com

title: Best Home Gear Celebrates 5-Year Milestone in Publishing - Asian American News Today - EIN Presswire
text:
Best Home Gear Celebrates 5-Year Milestone in Publishing The Best Rated Gas Fire Pit Tables for Your Patio
Image of the Logo for BestHomeGear.Com
Learn How to Paint Kitchen Cabinets (DIY)
Best Home Gear has just celebrated 5 Years as a Publisher in DIY Home Improvement, Lawn, Garden, and Home Repair Advice
"BestHomeGear is a great resource for DIY projects! I appreciate the clear instructions and economical tips on nearly anything I need help with. Dependable advice and tips from experts".” — Susan Nacy GRAND RAPIDS, MI, UNITED STATES, December 28, 2023 / EINPresswire.com / -- Headquartered in Grand Rapids, Michigan, Best Home Gear - a trusted source for DIY guides and product reviews for homeowners, is proud to announce its fifth anniversary in business. Since its inception, Best Home Gear has been dedicated to helping homeowners make informed decisions about their home equipment and projects. With a user-friendly website and a team of experts, Best Home Gear has become a go-to resource for those looking to improve their homes.
Founded by CEO Kevin Carroll, Best Home Gear has quickly established itself as a reliable and informative source for homeowners. The website offers a wide range of DIY guides, covering everything from home renovations to maintenance and repairs. In addition, Best Home Gear provides up-to-date product reviews to help visitors find the best equipment for their specific needs and budget.
"We are thrilled to celebrate five years in business and to have helped countless homeowners with their DIY projects and equipment choices," said Kevin Carroll, CEO of Best Home Gear. "Our goal has always been to provide valuable and unbiased information to our visitors, and we are proud to have become a trusted resource in the home improvement industry."
Best Home Gear's success can be attributed to its commitment to providing high-quality content and resources for homeowners. The website's team of experts thoroughly researches and tests products to provide honest and accurate reviews. With a focus on user experience, Best Home Gear's website is easy to navigate and offers a variety of helpful tools and resources.
As Best Home Gear looks towards the future, the company remains dedicated to its mission of helping homeowners make informed decisions about their homes. With a growing audience and a strong reputation, Best Home Gear is poised for continued success in the years to come. For more information, please visit https://www.besthomegear.com or contact the team at info@besthomegear.com.

author: Guillermo Peris Peris
title: Calor, tormentas, lluvias, rissagas y oleaje activan hoy los avisos en siete comunidades, con máximas de hasta 40ºC
text: Viajes y Lugares Tienda Siglo XXI Grupo Siglo XXI 21º ANIVERSARIO Fundado en noviembre de 2003 Opinión » Firmas y Blogs Viñetas Cartas Encuestas España Mundo Economía » Productividad Automóviles Empresas Deportes » Fútbol Baloncesto Tenis Motor Ciclismo Cultura » Cine Televisión y Medios Música Libros Sociedad » Moda y Tendencias Turismo y Gastronom. Ciencia » Salud Psicología Tecnología Meteorología Calor, tormentas, lluvias, rissagas y oleaje activan hoy los avisos en siete comunidades, con máximas de hasta 40ºC Agencias @DiarioSigloXXI viernes, 2 de agosto de 2024, 08:29 h (CET) MADRID, 2 (EUROPA PRESS) El calor continúa en el inicio del mes de agosto y, junto con otros fenómenos como tormentas, lluvias, rissagas y oleaje, activará los avisos en siete comunidades españolas, con máximas que podrán llegar a los 40ºC en puntos de Andalucía, según la predicción de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AEMET). Concretamente, las altas temperaturas pondrán en aviso importante Almería y Málaga, mientras que Córdoba, Huelva, Jaén, Sevilla, Albacete, Gerona, Lérida, Mallorca, Alicante, Valencia y Murcia tienen aviso amarillo. Por otro lado, tormentas y lluvias pondrán en riesgo a Guadalajara, Lérida, Tarragona, Castellón, Teruel, Barcelona y Gerona, aunque en el caso de las cuatro últimas ascenderá a naranja por tormentas. Las olas activarán el aviso amarillo en Gerona y Menorca lo estará por rissagas. Finalmente, en las Islas Canarias, Gran Canaria, La Palma, La Gomera, El Hierro y Tenerife estarán en alerta por fenómenos costeros, y solo Gran Canaria por altas temperaturas. La jornada estará marcada por la posibilidad de tormentas en la mitad noreste, siendo más probables y localmente fuertes en Pirineos e Ibérica, así como por las temperaturas significativamente elevadas en la mitad sur, interior sureste, Cataluña y sur de Gran Canaria, aunque habrá un descenso localmente notable de las máximas en el Ebro. En buena parte del país predominará el tiempo estable, con cielos poco nubosos o despejados o nubes medias y altas, no obstante, en el área cantábrica se esperan intervalos nubosos, especialmente matinales, con posibilidad de precipitaciones débiles y dispersas, más abundantes en el Cantábrico oriental, sin descartar chubascos durante la madrugada en el alto Ebro, Pirineo occidental y norte de la Ibérica y por la tarde en la Cantábrica. Asimismo, se formará nubosidad de evolución diurna en Pirineos y sistemas Ibérico y Central, con posibles chubascos y tormentas dispersos, más probables y localmente fuertes en Pirineos e Ibérica, que ocasionalmente pueden ir acompañados de granizo. En el valle del Ebro y zonas de la Meseta, la AEMET no descarta tormentas secas aisladas. En ambos archipiélagos y centro y sudeste peninsulares es posible la calima y probables bancos de niebla matinales en interiores de Galicia, Cantábrico y alto Ebro. En cuanto a las temperaturas, descenderán en general en la Península y Baleares, acusadamente las máximas en zonas del nordeste peninsular y se esperan pocos cambios en Canarias. Pese a los descensos, seguirán superándose los 35º C en interiores de la mitad sur y depresiones del nordeste peninsular, sin descartar puntos de Mallorca y sur de las islas Canarias, incluso los 40ºC en zonas del Guadalquivir y las mínimas tampoco bajarán de 25ºC en el área mediterránea. El viento soplará alisio moderado en Canarias, con intervalos de fuerte en zonas expuestas y predominarán vientos de componente norte en la mitad norte peninsular y área mediterránea oriental, en general flojos o moderados, con intervalos de fuerte en Ampurdán. En el resto de la vertiente atlántica, Estrecho y Alborán soplarán vientos del oeste, con intervalos de poniente fuerte en el Estrecho. Noticias relacionadas Agosto arranca con un descenso de las temperaturas tras un julio muy cálido y seco, según eltiempo.es La mitad del país sigue este jueves en aviso naranja o amarillo por la ola de calor, con máximas de hasta 43ºC en el sur La AEMET prevé que las temperaturas serán superiores a lo normal hasta el próximo mes de octubre La mitad del país sigue este jueves en aviso naranja o amarillo por la ola de calor, con máximas de hasta 43ºC en el sur Julio se despide con el pico de la tercera ola de calor del verano y agosto empieza con tormentas Quiénes somos | Sobre nosotros | Contacto | Aviso legal | | © 2024 Diario Siglo XXI. Periódico digital independiente, plural y abierto | Director: Guillermo Peris Peris

author: alejandro morteo
title: ¡Histórico! El 'Volcán' y Monterrey serán sede del Final Four de la Champions Cup W 2025
text:
¡Histórico! El ‘Volcán’ y Monterrey serán sede del Final Four de la Champions Cup W 2025
Tigres y América Femenil buscarán el título de la ‘Concachampions’ en las Semifinales que se disputarán en mayo del próximo año desde el estadio de las Amazonas
El histórico Estadio Universitario, casa de Tigres Femenil, ha sido seleccionado como sede del Final Four de la Champions Cup W, uno de los torneos más importantes del fútbol femenino en la región. Según Canal 6 Deportes, Monterrey albergará este prestigioso evento, que se celebrará en mayo de 2025.
El torneo contará con la participación de cuatro de los mejores equipos femeninos de la región: Tigres Femenil, Portland Thorns, América y Gotham FC.
Las semifinales se llevarán a cabo el miércoles 21 de mayo, enfrentando a
[ Tigres contra Portland Thorns ](https://vanguardia.com.mx/deportes/las-amazonas-conquistan-el-clasico-regio-en-la-concacaf-w-champions-cup-AD12996475)y a América contra Gotham FC, mientras que la final y el partido por el tercer lugar están programados para el 24 de mayo. Los horarios aún están por definirse.
TE PUEDE INTERESAR:
[Bears vs Seahawks: ¿a quién apostarle para el último Thursday Night Football del 2024 en la NFL?](https://vanguardia.com.mx/deportes/futbol-americano/bears-vs-seahawks-a-quien-apostarle-para-el-ultimo-thursday-night-football-del-2024-en-la-nfl-FI14493170)
La elección del Estadio Universitario como sede del torneo es un gran logro tanto para
[Tigres Femenil](https://x.com/TigresFemenil) como para la ciudad de Monterrey. El equipo de las Amazonas se impuso en la candidatura frente a importantes competidores como el Red Bull Arena (Estados Unidos), Providence Park (Estados Unidos) y el Estadio Ciudad de los Deportes (México). Este reconocimiento refuerza la creciente influencia y prestigio del equipo en el futbol femenino internacional.
“El Estadio Universitario de Nuevo León es un recinto histórico en nuestra región y ha sido sede de muchos grandes partidos de Concacaf a lo largo de los años.
“Confiamos en que será un excelente anfitrión para los cuatro clubes participantes y sus aficionados, mientras continúan su emocionante camino para convertirse en el primer campeón de clubes femeninos de la Confederación”, expresó Víctor Montagliani, presidente de Concacaf y vicepresidente de la FIFA.
El Final Four de la
[Champions Cup W](https://x.com/ConcacafW) no solo promete emocionantes encuentros, sino que también representa un gran impulso para el desarrollo del fútbol femenino en la región. Tigres Femenil reafirma su compromiso con la promoción del deporte al ser anfitrión de un evento de esta magnitud.
El “Volcán” será testigo de una competencia de alto nivel que definirá al mejor equipo femenino de la región. La expectación ya comienza a crecer entre los aficionados al futbol, quienes se preparan para vivir días históricos en el Estadio Universitario.
Con información de Milenio, Mediotiempo y Récord

organizations.name: Final Four de la Champions Cup W
